name: ChuSingura46+1 S
description: ChuSingura46+1S is an award-winning Japanese visual novel set in an alternate Edo Japan where all the Samurai are inexplicably female. You can get to know the “intimate” side of the characters from the classic Japanese tale of the 47 Ronin, all without any of the dangly or rough bits of the original!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core2 Duo Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel 3000HD DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 2100 MB available space Sound Card: Direct Sound

reviews.review_text: I came into this game with a box of tissues. Never thought I'd have to use them on my face.

I didn't know what to expect from this game. As I started playing it I was thinking 'oh, another boring vn'. I was so wrong. The plot was amazing as well as characters. I enjoyed every single part of the history. I totally identified with main character. Haven't played chapter 2 and 3 yet and I don't know if I trurly want- not because of price to spend but rather because I felt in love along with main character and I don't know if I can accept another possible route (who ended ch 1, should undertand what I mean). The ending was emotional masterpiece- one of the best I have ever seen.
Awesome game novel that i got hooked on immediately. Spent like 8-9 consecutive hours on it to finish it... Can't wait for the next series, hopefully connected!
This is a lot of game/story for free. No disappointment here.

Surprisingly, I didn't not jack off once during the game play.     This game doesn't show as much nuditiy as you think it would but the story makes it up for that; though the story can be boring at times and I just spam click while trying to read all the text, it usually works out in the end.  Why did the main character go for the MILF? Why did he succeed?   (teach me your ways, sensei)   You could obviously tell that some of the girls were interested in him. And by some, I mean more than half. How does it not see that? Even the loli girls were going for him, 2 EVEN!  10/10 would face palm again everytime I cringe when a new girl shows up with big exposed breasts.

ChuSingura 46+1 S is a visual novel developed by Inre. For those new to this concept, visual novels are interactive games that have very few choices if any at all. The concept might seem boring, but those interested in books ChuSingura is a jewel among VNs. It is also one of the games that will make you think of your own life and wonder what would you do different if you could travel back in time?  The main protagonist is Fukami Suguha, an average Japanese student that ends up transported back in time during the Genroku era in 1701 CE. The story essentially deals with the 47 Ronins and their plans to avenge their lord unjustly while also restoring the family’s honor. It is a story of courage, bravery, romance, mystery, magic and duty.   The game is excellent when it comes to provoking emotions in the player thanks to the amazing special effects used when the samurai are fighting with their swords, the music and the imagery. Some moments will be so touching that the player will shed tears.   I personally did not encounter any bugs with the game, but there were some minor translation errors, although nothing major.  Each chapter of ChuSingura is excellent and so far I played the 3 released. I think it is worth giving a try considering the fact chapter 1 is free for everyone and chapter 2 and 3 are bundled for 20$. Each chapter deals with the same story but someone else’s perspective as well as different events.   Overall, I think ChuSingura is one of the best visual novels I’ve read and I would gladly recommend it to anyone (heck, first chapter is free, so why not?). I give the game overall with its dlc a 9.5 (lost 0.5 for the minor translation errors). It is a must have in your collection.

92 Ronin review    yeah, 92 ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)     So this is basically the famous japan story of the 47 ronin who avenged their lord and blah blah blah, but the slight difference that in this case they are all female because of '(plot)-(plot) reasons   no one would even bother to check it if were otherwise.  Mind that there are fantasy elements similar to the movie of the same story which came some years ago.  I must admit that i really got hooked into the story, the Voice acting, the characters, and the music, specially this last one are very well done and i found them quite charming.  Ejem* Naturally, there is a slight amount of fanservice, not a big deal annyway,   or it is?.    The first chapter is free and it have a very acceptable duration to introduce the first and probably most important part of the story, is a great oportunity to go and try if you are into Visual novels, i asure you if you get into it, the ending will result so cliffhanger, i`m looking for the others chapters now.

Boobs, feels, and plot.  ...Plus its free.  I was really not expecting an extremely good story from this visual novel, but lo and behold, there it is. There are no choices to make in the game, as you basically time travel in the past to the Edo era, so those of you lookin to get it on with your genderbent waifu, nope, too bad. Once you get past all of its fanservice, the plot really gets to you. Sure it's cliche, with its 'Lets have a likeable protag with some typical special skills!' but still, it had its charms and plot twists.  Give it a try. 9/10

After listening through, I have to say, the story is very well done and the way it was presented is beautiful, i cant wait for more chapters to release like this one    Update: i just finished chapters 2 and 3... the story really pulls at your emotions. for the most part, it left me with a kind of a soft sadness but in a good way, now i await for chapters 4 and 5...

♥♥♥♥,moar ♥♥♥♥ and it's free...go try this game out This game is longer than i expected but it sent an aww feeling till the end. so far i enjoy the story,but without the choice of interacting with other character feels dead to me. you play as suguha which the protagonist try to change the fate of 47 ronin but fail in the end in this free version. and you get back to the first day when you arrive in AKO province and that is where i fell the story is not complete if you did not buy the DLC ver. but hey for a free game with 14+ hour reading time is quite inspiring. HOWEVER,if this game can give me a choice to interact with other girls would be great. another thing i dislike in this VN is no archievement and Trading Card which put me off from buying the DLC. i mean sure the story is great however the lack of choice in interacting with other girls really hold me off from purchasing the game . If there is a trading Card or archievement maybe i will purchase it but hey i recomend it to people to try it first. Even if there is no H scene,im fine with that cause i do some research already,the art is not that great to me to have H/eroge in it. the story is what matter. in the end it really do tale a part of history of japan regarding the fate of 47 ronin. even IF you Cut the White Serpent BS.

The game is going good so far, have not run into any troubles what so ever and by what i can tell the story line is good and is getting better. to be honest its just like watching a anime where you have a break and 5 minutes later you want to play again. the games characters look awesome if anything it just needs to have better backgrounds i recon.  9/10

Oh my God. What a wonderful game.  This VN is basically a historical recount of the famous 47 Ronin story, albeit with some cute anime girls added in.  First off, yes, get it, it's wonderful.  It's an emotional rollercoaster, definitely. You'll feel love and happiness and hope and sadness, possibly all at once. Personally, I sort of fell in love with Chikara and Shinroku, but there's redeeming qualities in all the characters. It's a linear VN with no choices, but I felt engaged with the story and I was interested all the way through, despite that.  It's a marathon, but it keeps you into it until the very end. I won't spoil it for you, but the ending may surprise you.  By the end, I felt a connection to Suguha and all the girls (and Kitchenman, but we don't talk about him.)  The storytelling is very good at its core, despite the occasional spelling error or translation bug. Some words used by the Ronin hadn't even been invented yet (like 'awesome') but I think I can give it a pass since it doesn't affect the storytelling.  This game appeals to anime fans, history lovers, or the offhand VN enthusiast.   10/10, would cry again and tell my girlfriend that I love her out of the sadness this VN gave me.
This was an awesome game.I love the characters.I hope another version comes out soon.Good job devolepers.
Can't wait for another chapter!

Chusingura46+1 S   is a visual novel brought to life by   Inre   and published by   NextNinja   [for Steam] that introduces the readers to the life of a high school student who is transported 300 years back into the “body of a samurai” during the Edo period, where the story is a revival of the epic tale   Ronin 47   in which the characters are inexplicably female!  There are several compliments that I have, where the first is how engaging the story develops from the voice acting and dialogue. Unlike visual novels that we would normally read, these voice actors give the characters personality to the extent where most of the time it stimulates my curiosity to know more on how characters we are introduced to develop as the story progress. Another positive feature with regards to   Chusingura46+1 S   are the options given when reading the visual novel. We are given the power to change our experience on how the visual novel is illustrated (   which includes the speed of message display, volume, language for the dialogue and vice versa   ), and as for myself, I have opted of my experience to the point where I was watching a movie. Speaking of features, we are also given a biography “section” of all the characters introduced, which allows us to understand a characters role in the story, a characters history, and their motives.   However where there is good, there is always room for improvement.   The only issue I’ve discovered when reading the visual novel is through the “auto play” option  . There are a few sections of the story where the voice and the dialogue are not in sync, sometimes the dialogue go way faster than the scripted voice completing his/her sentence, which causes an unusual overlap between voices. Be diligent when using this feature until an update is made to fix this minor issue.  I would highly suggest anyone who have an interest in visual novels to give   Chusingura46+1 S   a try as the first chapter is free, but as for my experience, I am very keen on purchasing the official release of this product.

Good story.

This is a kinetic novel that is a rewrite of the classic Japanese tale of the 47 ronin. + Very good art work good quality sound Great rewriting of a classic story Long (each DLC is as long as a bogo standard VN/KN) - The last two chapters have some translation issues (at the time of writing this review)  At first glance its just the 47 Ronin with women with big breasts (which would be good in itself), but when you actually experience the novel you soon find it has been well thought out plot wise and also allot of care and attention has been put into the production standards. It has a good quality feel to it with voice acting throughout and high quality art The developer has been clever using the fan service to get a much loved story moved back into the limelight, making it accessible to the disaffected Japanese youth and as a side effect opened it up to the western markets as well (although the localisation and 'all ages' conversion has lost quite a bit from the original). The translation is pretty garbled in the last two chapters and needs to be reworked.  The strong starting story, solid rewrite, good plot and well... lest face it, giant breasted sword swinging female samurai, makes this well worth your cash.

I could see the display but it was distorted to the point where I could not even reconize what was in front of me, The plot/story sounded somewhat interesting, but not really my style. So I call this a waste of time in my book.
